The Autumn Garden Hotel is a traditional-style hotel located in a hutong, offering a glimpse into old Beijing with its quiet courtyard setting. The hotel provides a trishaw service to the main road and is within walking distance of Tiananmen Square.

The Bamboo Garden Hotel is located in a hutong and has a tranquil courtyard, red lanterned walkways, mini ponds with koi, and gardens. Some rooms have a view of the courtyard reminiscent of a mountain scene.

The Century Towers Beijing offers apartment-style rooms with multiple bedrooms, full kitchens, and living/dining areas. Some rooms include a flat-screen TV, and the hotel has a workout room and small restaurant.

The hotel has an older section with a coffee shop named 1918, suggesting some historical character; some reviewers mentioned distant views of Beijing from higher floors. One reviewer mentioned a karaoke bar and nightclub on the premises.

The Far East Hotel/Hostel is located in Beijing's traditional hutongs, featuring a traditional courtyard that creates a friendly atmosphere. The hostel offers a cafe with a variety of food and a basement bar with internet access and movie screenings.

The Beijing Friendship Hotel is a large complex with multiple buildings connected by underground passageways, featuring gardens and traditional Beijing-style architecture, creating a tranquil atmosphere away from the city's chaos. Built in the 1950s, the hotel has a unique, somewhat quirky feel with a mix of old and remodeled rooms, various restaurants, and shops scattered throughout the compound.
The Guangming Hotel is located off the 3rd Ring Road near embassies and a food street. It features modern, hi-tech rooms with LCD TVs and international channels, and a clean, 5-star-ish lobby.

The Beijing Hotel is a historic hotel consisting of three distinct buildings, with Building B being the oldest and Building C dating back to pre-Mao times, featuring decor from old communist China. The hotel has a long history and hosted dignitaries for close to a century.

The hotel has a revolving restaurant on the 28th floor with great views of the city and a spacious foyer. Some reviewers found the lobby to be nicely decorated and magnificent, while another described the decor as uninspiring.

The Jade Youth Hostel has traditional-style decor in the breakfast area and reading room, and offers Emperor/Empress suits for guests to try on for photos. Some reviewers describe the hostel as more like a hotel than a typical hostel.

Sihe Hotel is a traditional courtyard hotel located in a hutong, featuring antique Chinese furnishings and a peaceful courtyard garden. The hotel is known for its quiet atmosphere and traditional Chinese ambiance.

The hotel is described as modern and luxurious, with marble columns, glass adornments, and sophisticated lighting systems. Rooms feature amenities such as flat-screen TVs, separate showers and bathtubs, and mechanized curtains.

The Capital Hotel has a grand lobby with statuettes and a live fish tank, and also features a bowling alley, pool, and several restaurants. Some reviewers found the hotel depressing due to it being large and often empty.
The China World Hotel has a grand and opulent lobby with live music, and rooms are decorated with wood trim and art work. Some reviewers describe the hotel as luxurious and grand.

The City Hotel is centrally located in Beijing, close to bars and restaurants, and provides easy access to the subway. Some rooms are apartments with multiple beds, but some guests have reported issues with hard beds, a lack of utensils, and rooms in shabby condition.

The Commune by the Great Wall is a collection of architect-designed villas in a secluded valley with private access to an unrestored section of the Great Wall. The hotel's unique design, peaceful setting, and proximity to the Great Wall provide a memorable experience.
